name: akamai
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing akamai cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`akamai` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/akamai/terraform-provider-akamai).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing akamai cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/akamai/terraform-provider-akamai)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-akamai` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-akamai/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-akamai` repo](https://github.com/akamai/terraform-provider-akamai/issues).

configSection.description: The section of the edgerc file to use for configuration

requestLimit.description: The maximum number of API requests to be made per second (0 for no limit)

description.description: A description of the item.

value.description: Value of the item. (i.e. IP address, AS Number, GEO, ...etc)

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: Describes if cloud server host header is overridden

cloudService.description: Describes if this datacenter is a cloud service

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located

country.description: The country in which the data center is located

hostname.description: This should match the 'hostname' value defined for this datacenter in Property Manager

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an application load balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

originId.description: The ID of an origin that represents the data center. The conditional origin, which is defined in the Property Manager API, must have an originType of either CUSTOMER or NET_STORAGE

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all data centers must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located

additionalHeaders.description: Maps additional case-insensitive HTTP header names included to the liveness testing requests

hostHeader.description: The Host header for the liveness HTTP request

interval.description: Describes how often the liveness test will be performed. Optional defaults to 60 seconds, minimum is 10 seconds.

path.description: The path to the test object used for liveness testing. The function of the test object is to help determine whether the data center is functioning.

peerCertificateVerification.description: Describes whether or not to validate the origin certificate for an HTTPS request

port.description: The port for the test object. The default port is 80, which is standard for HTTP. Enter 443 if you are using HTTPS.

protocol.description: The protocol or scheme for the database, either HTTP or HTTPS.

requestString.description: The request which will be used for TCP(S) tests

status3xxFailure.description: Set to true to mark the liveness test as failed when the request returns a 3xx (redirection) status code.

status4xxFailure.description: Set to true to mark the liveness test as failed when the request returns a 4xx (client error) status code.

status5xxFailure.description: Set to true to mark the liveness test as failed when the request returns a 5xx (server error) status code.

timeout.description: The number of seconds the system waits before failing the liveness test. The default is 25 seconds.

create.description: Optional configurable activation timeout to be used on resource create. By default it's 4h with 1s pooling interval.

update.description: Optional configurable activation timeout to be used on resource update. By default it's 4h with 1s pooling interval.

capacity.description: The capacity assigned to this configuration's location

comments.description: Additional comments provided by the user.

trafficTypeId.description: Unique identifier for the location and traffic type combination

unit.description: Unit of capacity. Can be either 'GB' or 'TB'.

value.description: Value of capacity.

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

containerName.description: Specifies the Azure Storage container name

path.description: The path to the folder within Azure Storage container where logs will be stored

authToken.description: The API key associated with Datadog account

endpoint.description: The Datadog endpoint where logs will be stored

service.description: The service of the Datadog connector

source.description: The source of the Datadog connector

tags.description: The tags of the Datadog connector

fieldDelimiter.description: A delimiter that you use to separate data set fields in log lines

format.description: The format in which logs will be received

frequency.description: The frequency of collecting logs from each uploader and sending these logs to a destination

uploadFilePrefix.description: The prefix of the log file that will be send to a destination

uploadFileSuffix.description: The suffix of the log file that will be send to a destination

intervalInSecs.description: The time in seconds after which the system bundles log lines into a file and sends it to a destination

caCert.description: The certification authority (CA) certificate used to verify the origin server's certificate. If the certificate is not signed by a well-known certification authority, enter the CA certificate in the PEM format for verification.

clientCert.description: The PEM-formatted digital certificate you want to authenticate requests to your destination with. If you want to use mutual authentication, you need to provide both the client certificate and the client key.

clientKey.description: The private key in the non-encrypted PKCS8 format you want to use to authenticate with the backend server. If you want to use mutual authentication, you need to provide both the client certificate and the client key.

contentType.description: The type of the resource passed in the request's custom header. For details, see Additional options in the DataStream user guide.

customHeaderName.description: A human-readable name for the request's custom header, containing only alphanumeric, dash, and underscore characters. For details, see Additional options in the DataStream user guide.

customHeaderValue.description: The custom header's contents passed with the request that contains information about the client connection. For details, see Additional options in the DataStream user guide.

endpoint.description: The Elasticsearch bulk endpoint URL in the https://hostname.elastic-cloud.com:9243/_bulk/ format. Set indexName in the appropriate field instead of providing it in the URL. You can use Akamaized property hostnames as endpoint URLs. See Stream logs to Elasticsearch.

indexName.description: The index name of the Elastic cloud where you want to store log files.

mTls.description: Indicates whether mTLS is enabled or not.

password.description: The Elasticsearch basic access authentication password.

tlsHostname.description: The hostname that verifies the server's certificate and matches the Subject Alternative Names (SANs) in the certificate. If not provided, DataStream fetches the hostname from the endpoint URL.

userName.description: The Elasticsearch basic access authentication username.

bucket.description: The name of the storage bucket created in Google Cloud account

compressLogs.description: Indicates whether the logs should be compressed

path.description: The path to the folder within Google Cloud bucket where logs will be stored

privateKey.description: The contents of the JSON private key generated and downloaded in Google Cloud Storage account

projectId.description: The unique ID of Google Cloud project

serviceAccountName.description: The name of the service account with the storage.object.create permission or Storage Object Creator role

authenticationType.description: Either NONE for no authentication, or BASIC for username and password authentication

caCert.description: The certification authority (CA) certificate used to verify the origin server's certificate. If the certificate is not signed by a well-known certification authority, enter the CA certificate in the PEM format for verification.

clientCert.description: The digital certificate in the PEM format you want to use to authenticate requests to your destination. If you want to use mutual authentication, you need to provide both the client certificate and the client key (in the PEM format).

clientKey.description: The private key in the non-encrypted PKCS8 format you want to use to authenticate with the back-end server. If you want to use mutual authentication, you need to provide both the client certificate and the client key.

contentType.description: Content type to pass in the log file header

customHeaderValue.description: The custom header's contents passed with the request to the destination

city.description: The name of the city where the data center is located.

cloneOf.description: Identifies the data center's ID of which this data center is a clone.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: Balances load between two or more servers in a cloud environment.

cloudServerTargeting.description: Balances load between two or more servers in a cloud environment.

continent.description: A two-letter code that specifies the continent where the data center maps to.

country.description: A two-letter ISO 3166 country code that specifies the country where the data center is located.

datacenterId.description: A unique identifier for an existing data center in the domain.

defaultLoadObjects.description: Specifies the load reporting interface between you and the GTM system.

latitude.description: Specifies the geographic latitude of the data center's position.

links.description: Provides a URL path that allows direct navigation to a data center.

longitude.description: Specifies the geographic longitude of the data center's position.

nickname.description: A descriptive label for the datacenter.

scorePenalty.description: Influences the score for a datacenter.

servermonitorPool.description: The name of the pool from which servermonitors are drawn for liveness tests in this datacenter. If omitted (null), the domain-wide default is used. (If no domain-wide default is specified, the pool used is all servermonitors in the same continent as the datacenter.)

stateOrProvince.description: Specifies a two-letter ISO 3166 country code for the state of province, where the data center is located.

virtual.description: Indicates whether or not the data center is virtual or physical.

loadObject.description: Specifies the load object that GTM requests.

loadObjectPort.description: Specifies the TCP port to connect to when requesting the load object.

loadServers.description: Specifies the list of servers to requests the load object from.

href.description: A hypermedia link to the complete URL that uniquely defines a resource.

rel.description: Indicates the link relationship of the object.

description.description: Granted role description

name.description: Granted role name

createdBy.description: The user name or email of the person who created the role

description.description: The role's description

modifiedBy.description: The username or email of the last person to edit the role

name.description: The role's name

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role

timeCreated.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the role was originally created

timeModified.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the role was last updated

type.description: Whether the role is a standard role or a custom role

description.description: The description of a time zone, including the GMT +/-

offset.description: The time zone offset from GMT

breakpoints.description: The breakpoint widths (in pixels) to use to create derivative images/videos.

hosts.description: Hosts that are allowed for image/video URLs within transformations or variables.

output.description: Dictates the output quality (either `quality` or `perceptualQuality`) and formats that are created for each resized image. If unspecified, image formats are created to support all browsers at the default quality level (`85`), which includes formats such as WEBP, JPEG2000 and JPEG-XR for specific browsers.

postBreakpointTransformations.description: Post-processing Transformations are applied to the image after image and quality settings have been applied.

rolloutDuration.description: The amount of time in seconds that the policy takes to rollout. During the rollout an increasing proportion of images/videos will begin to use the new policy instead of the cached images/videos from the previous version. This value has no effect on the staging network.

transformations.description: Set of image transformations to apply to the source image. If unspecified, no operations are performed.

variables.description: Declares variables for use within the policy. Any variable declared here can be invoked throughout transformations as a Variable object, so that you don't have to specify values separately. You can also pass in these variable names and values dynamically as query parameters in the image's request URL.

adaptiveQuality.description: Override the quality of image to serve when Image & Video Manager detects a slow connection. Specifying lower values lets users with slow connections browse your site with reduced load times without impacting the quality of images for users with faster connections.

allowedFormats.description: The graphics file formats allowed for browser specific results.

forcedFormats.description: The forced extra formats for the `imFormat` query parameter, which requests a specific browser type. By default, Image and Video Manager detects the browser and returns the appropriate image.

perceptualQuality.description: Mutually exclusive with quality. The perceptual quality to use when comparing resulting images, which overrides the `quality` setting. Perceptual quality tunes each image format's quality parameter dynamically based on the human-perceived quality of the output image. This can result in better byte savings (as compared to using regular quality) as many images can be encoded at a much lower quality without compromising perception of the image. In addition, certain images may need to be encoded at a slightly higher quality in order to maintain human-perceived quality. Values are tiered `high`, `mediumHigh`, `medium`, `mediumLow`, or `low`.

perceptualQualityFloor.description: Only applies with perceptualQuality set. Sets a minimum image quality to respect when using perceptual quality. Perceptual quality will not reduce the quality below this value even if it determines the compressed image to be acceptably visually similar.

perceptualQualityVar.description: Mutually exclusive with quality. The perceptual quality to use when comparing resulting images, which overrides the `quality` setting. Perceptual quality tunes each image format's quality parameter dynamically based on the human-perceived quality of the output image. This can result in better byte savings (as compared to using regular quality) as many images can be encoded at a much lower quality without compromising perception of the image. In addition, certain images may need to be encoded at a slightly higher quality in order to maintain human-perceived quality. Values are tiered `high`, `mediumHigh`, `medium`, `mediumLow`, or `low`.

quality.description: Mutually exclusive with perceptualQuality, used by default if neither is specified. The chosen quality of the output images. Using a quality value from 1-100 resembles JPEG quality across output formats.

qualityVar.description: Mutually exclusive with perceptualQuality, used by default if neither is specified. The chosen quality of the output images. Using a quality value from 1-100 resembles JPEG quality across output formats.

backgroundColors.description: Places a transparent image on a set background color. Color is specified in the typical CSS hexadecimal format.

blurs.description: Applies a Gaussian blur to the image.

chromaKeys.description: Changes any color in an image within the specified volume of the HSL colorspace to transparent or semitransparent. This transformation applies a 'green screen' technique commonly used to isolate and remove background colors.

composites.description: Applies another image to the source image, either as an overlay or an underlay. The image that's underneath is visible in areas that are beyond the edges of the top image or that are less than 100% opaque. A common use of an overlay composite is to add a watermark.

contrasts.description: Adjusts both the contrast and brightness of an image.

goops.description: Distorts an image by randomly repositioning a set of control points along a specified grid. The transformed image appears _goopy_. Adjust the density of the grid and the degree of randomity. You can use this transformation to create watermarks for use in security.

grayscales.description: Restricts image color to shades of gray only.

hsls.description: Adjusts the hue, saturation, and lightness (HSL) of an image. Hue is the number of degrees that colors rotate around the color wheel. Saturation is a multiplier to increase or decrease color saturation. Lightness is a multiplier to increase or decrease the lightness of an image. Other transformations can also affect color, such as `Grayscale` and `MaxColors`. If youre using more than one, consider the order to apply them for the desired results.

hsvs.description: Identical to HSL except it replaces `lightness` with `value`. For example, if you reduce the `lightness` of a light green, almost white, image, the color turns a vibrant green. Reducing the `value` turns the image a darker color, close to grey. This happens because the original image color is very close to white.

maxColors.description: Set the maximum number of colors in the images palette. Reducing the number of colors in an image can help to reduce file size.

mirrors.description: Flips an image horizontally, vertically, or both.

monoHues.description: Allows you to set all hues in an image to a single specified hue of your choosing. Mono Hue maintains the original colors lightness and saturation but sets the hue to that of the specified value. This has the effect of making the image shades of the specified hue.

opacities.description: Adjusts the level of transparency of an image. Use this transformation to make an image more or less transparent.

removeColors.description: Removes a specified color from an image and replaces it with transparent pixels. This transformation is ideal for removing solid background colors from product images photographed on clean, consistent backgrounds without any shadows.

unsharpMasks.description: Emphasizes edges and details in source images without distorting the colors. Although this effect is often referred to as _sharpening_ an image, it actually creates a blurred, inverted copy of the image known as an unsharp mask. Image and Video Manager combines the unsharp mask with the source image to create an image perceived as clearer.

color.description: The hexadecimal CSS color value for the background.

colorVar.description: The hexadecimal CSS color value for the background.

sigma.description: The number of pixels to scatter the original pixel by to create the blur effect. Resulting images may be larger than the original as pixels at the edge of the image might scatter outside the image's original dimensions.

sigmaVar.description: The number of pixels to scatter the original pixel by to create the blur effect. Resulting images may be larger than the original as pixels at the edge of the image might scatter outside the image's original dimensions.

hue.description: The hue to remove. Enter the degree of rotation between 0 and 360 degrees around the color wheel. By default Chroma Key removes a green hue, 120 on the color wheel.

hueFeather.description: How much additional hue to make semi-transparent beyond the Hue Tolerance. By default Hue Feather is 0.083 which applies semi-transparency to hues 30 around the Hue Tolerance.

hueFeatherVar.description: How much additional hue to make semi-transparent beyond the Hue Tolerance. By default Hue Feather is 0.083 which applies semi-transparency to hues 30 around the Hue Tolerance.

hueTolerance.description: How close a color's hue needs to be to the selected hue for it to be changed to fully transparent. If you enter the maximum value of 1.0 the entire image is made transparent. By default Hue Tolerance is approximately 0.083 or 8.3% of the color wheel. This value corresponds to 30 around the specified hue.

hueToleranceVar.description: How close a color's hue needs to be to the selected hue for it to be changed to fully transparent. If you enter the maximum value of 1.0 the entire image is made transparent. By default Hue Tolerance is approximately 0.083 or 8.3% of the color wheel. This value corresponds to 30 around the specified hue.

hueVar.description: The hue to remove. Enter the degree of rotation between 0 and 360 degrees around the color wheel. By default Chroma Key removes a green hue, 120 on the color wheel.

lightnessFeather.description: How much additional lightness to make semi-transparent beyond the Lightness Tolerance. The default value of 0.1 corresponds to 10% away from the tolerated lightness towards full black or full white.

lightnessFeatherVar.description: How much additional lightness to make semi-transparent beyond the Lightness Tolerance. The default value of 0.1 corresponds to 10% away from the tolerated lightness towards full black or full white.

lightnessTolerance.description: How much of the lightest part and darkest part of a color to preserve. For example, you can space this value out from the middle (i.e. 0.5 lightness or full color) to help preserve the splash lighting impact in the image. You can define how close the color needs to be to the full color to remove it from your image. The default value of 0.75 means that a colour must be within 75% of the full color to full white or full black for full removal.

lightnessToleranceVar.description: How much of the lightest part and darkest part of a color to preserve. For example, you can space this value out from the middle (i.e. 0.5 lightness or full color) to help preserve the splash lighting impact in the image. You can define how close the color needs to be to the full color to remove it from your image. The default value of 0.75 means that a colour must be within 75% of the full color to full white or full black for full removal.

saturationFeather.description: How much additional saturation to make semi-transparent beyond the Saturation Tolerance. By default Saturation Feather is 0.1 which applies semi-transparency to hues 10% below the saturationTolerance.

saturationFeatherVar.description: How much additional saturation to make semi-transparent beyond the Saturation Tolerance. By default Saturation Feather is 0.1 which applies semi-transparency to hues 10% below the saturationTolerance.

saturationTolerance.description: How close a color's saturation needs to be to full saturation for it to be changed to fully transparent. For example, you can define how green the color needs to be to remove it from your image. The default value of 0.75 means that a color must be within 75% of full saturation in order to be made fully transparent.

saturationToleranceVar.description: How close a color's saturation needs to be to full saturation for it to be changed to fully transparent. For example, you can define how green the color needs to be to remove it from your image. The default value of 0.75 means that a color must be within 75% of full saturation in order to be made fully transparent.

gravity.description: Compass direction indicating the corner or edge of the base image to place the applied image. Use Horizontal and Vertical Offset to adjust the applied image's gravity position

gravityVar.description: Compass direction indicating the corner or edge of the base image to place the applied image. Use Horizontal and Vertical Offset to adjust the applied image's gravity position

placement.description: Place applied image on top of or underneath the base image. Watermarks are usually applied over. Backgrounds are usually applied under.

placementVar.description: Place applied image on top of or underneath the base image. Watermarks are usually applied over. Backgrounds are usually applied under.

scale.description: A multiplier to resize the applied image relative to the source image and preserve aspect ratio, 1 by default. Set the `scaleDimension` to calculate the `scale` from the source image's width or height.

scaleDimension.description: The dimension, either `width` or `height`, of the source image to scale.

scaleDimensionVar.description: The dimension, either `width` or `height`, of the source image to scale.

scaleVar.description: A multiplier to resize the applied image relative to the source image and preserve aspect ratio, 1 by default. Set the `scaleDimension` to calculate the `scale` from the source image's width or height.

xPosition.description: The x-axis position of the image to apply.

xPositionVar.description: The x-axis position of the image to apply.

yPosition.description: The y-axis position of the image to apply.

yPositionVar.description: The y-axis position of the image to apply.

boxImages.description: A rectangular box, with a specified color and applied transformation.

circleImages.description: A rectangular box, with a specified color and applied transformation.

textImages.description: A snippet of text. Defines font family and size, fill color, and outline stroke width and color.

urlImages.description: An image loaded from a URL.

color.description: The fill color of the box, not the edge of the box. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

colorVar.description: The fill color of the box, not the edge of the box. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

height.description: The height of the box in pixels.

heightVar.description: The height of the box in pixels.

width.description: The width of the box in pixels.

widthVar.description: The width of the box in pixels.

color.description: The fill color of the circle. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

colorVar.description: The fill color of the circle. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

diameter.description: The diameter of the circle. The diameter will be the width and the height of the image in pixels.

diameterVar.description: The diameter of the circle. The diameter will be the width and the height of the image in pixels.

width.description: The width of the box in pixels.

widthVar.description: The width of the box in pixels.

fill.description: The main fill color of the text.

fillVar.description: The main fill color of the text.

size.description: The size in pixels to render the text.

sizeVar.description: The size in pixels to render the text.

stroke.description: The color for the outline of the text.

strokeSize.description: The thickness in points for the outline of the text.

strokeSizeVar.description: The thickness in points for the outline of the text.

strokeVar.description: The color for the outline of the text.

text.description: The line of text to render.

textVar.description: The line of text to render.

typeface.description: The font family to apply to the text image. This may be a URL to a TrueType or WOFF (v1) typeface, or a string that refers to one of the standard built-in browser fonts.

typefaceVar.description: The font family to apply to the text image. This may be a URL to a TrueType or WOFF (v1) typeface, or a string that refers to one of the standard built-in browser fonts.

brightness.description: Adjusts the brightness of the image. Positive values increase brightness and negative values decrease brightness. A value of  `1` produces a white image. A value of  `-1` produces a black image. The default value is `0`, which leaves the image unchanged. The acceptable value range is `-1.0` to `1.0`. Values outside of the acceptable range clamp to this range.

brightnessVar.description: Adjusts the brightness of the image. Positive values increase brightness and negative values decrease brightness. A value of  `1` produces a white image. A value of  `-1` produces a black image. The default value is `0`, which leaves the image unchanged. The acceptable value range is `-1.0` to `1.0`. Values outside of the acceptable range clamp to this range.

contrast.description: Adjusts the contrast of the image. Expressed as a range from `-1` to `1`, positive values increase contrast, negative values decrease it, while `0` leaves the image unchanged. Values outside of the `-1` to `1` range clamp to this range.

contrastVar.description: Adjusts the contrast of the image. Expressed as a range from `-1` to `1`, positive values increase contrast, negative values decrease it, while `0` leaves the image unchanged. Values outside of the `-1` to `1` range clamp to this range.

chaos.description: Specifies the greatest distance control points may move from their original position. A value of `1.0` shifts control points over as far as the next one in the original grid. A value of `0.0` leaves the image unchanged. Values under `0.5` work better for subtle distortions, otherwise control points may pass each other and cause a twisting effect.

chaosVar.description: Specifies the greatest distance control points may move from their original position. A value of `1.0` shifts control points over as far as the next one in the original grid. A value of `0.0` leaves the image unchanged. Values under `0.5` work better for subtle distortions, otherwise control points may pass each other and cause a twisting effect.

density.description: Controls the density of control points used to distort the image. The largest dimension of the input image is divided up to fit this number of control points. A grid of points is extended on the smaller dimension such that each row and column of control points is equidistant from each adjacent row or column. This parameter strongly affects transformation performance. Be careful choosing values above the default if you expect to transform medium to large size images.

densityVar.description: Controls the density of control points used to distort the image. The largest dimension of the input image is divided up to fit this number of control points. A grid of points is extended on the smaller dimension such that each row and column of control points is equidistant from each adjacent row or column. This parameter strongly affects transformation performance. Be careful choosing values above the default if you expect to transform medium to large size images.

power.description: By default, the distortion algorithm relies on inverse squares to calculate distance but this allows you to change the exponent. You shouldnt need to vary the default value of `2.0`.

powerVar.description: By default, the distortion algorithm relies on inverse squares to calculate distance but this allows you to change the exponent. You shouldnt need to vary the default value of `2.0`.

seed.description: Specifies your own `seed` value as an alternative to the default, which is subject to variability. This allows for reproducible and deterministic distortions. If all parameters are kept equal and a constant seed is used, `Goop` distorts an input image consistently over many transformations. By default, this value is set to the current Epoch Time measured in milliseconds, which provides inconsistent transformation output.

seedVar.description: Specifies your own `seed` value as an alternative to the default, which is subject to variability. This allows for reproducible and deterministic distortions. If all parameters are kept equal and a constant seed is used, `Goop` distorts an input image consistently over many transformations. By default, this value is set to the current Epoch Time measured in milliseconds, which provides inconsistent transformation output.

type.description: The algorithm used to transform colors to grays, either `Brightness`, `Lightness`, `Rec601`, or the default `Rec709`.

typeVar.description: The algorithm used to transform colors to grays, either `Brightness`, `Lightness`, `Rec601`, or the default `Rec709`.

hue.description: The number of degrees to rotate colors around the color wheel, `0` by default.

hueVar.description: The number of degrees to rotate colors around the color wheel, `0` by default.

lightness.description: A multiplier to adjust the lightness of colors in the image. Note that lightness is distinct from brightness. For example, reducing the lightness of a light green might give you a lime green whereas reducing the brightness of a light green might give you a darker shade of the same green. Values less than `1.0` decrease the lightness of colors in the image. Values greater than `1.0` increase the lightness of colors in the image.

lightnessVar.description: A multiplier to adjust the lightness of colors in the image. Note that lightness is distinct from brightness. For example, reducing the lightness of a light green might give you a lime green whereas reducing the brightness of a light green might give you a darker shade of the same green. Values less than `1.0` decrease the lightness of colors in the image. Values greater than `1.0` increase the lightness of colors in the image.

saturation.description: A multiplier to adjust the saturation of colors in the image. Values less than `1.0` decrease saturation and values greater than `1.0` increase the saturation. A value of `0.0` removes all color from the image.

saturationVar.description: A multiplier to adjust the saturation of colors in the image. Values less than `1.0` decrease saturation and values greater than `1.0` increase the saturation. A value of `0.0` removes all color from the image.

hue.description: The number of degrees to rotate colors around the color wheel, `0.0` by default.

hueVar.description: The number of degrees to rotate colors around the color wheel, `0.0` by default.

saturation.description: A multiplier to adjust the saturation of colors in the image. Values less than `1.0` decrease saturation and values greater than `1.0` increase the saturation. A value of `0.0` removes all color from the image.

saturationVar.description: A multiplier to adjust the saturation of colors in the image. Values less than `1.0` decrease saturation and values greater than `1.0` increase the saturation. A value of `0.0` removes all color from the image.

value.description: A multiplier to adjust the lightness or darkness of the images base color. Values less than 1.0 decrease the base colors in the image, making them appear darker. Values greater than 1.0 increase the base colors in the image, making them appear lighter.

valueVar.description: A multiplier to adjust the lightness or darkness of the images base color. Values less than 1.0 decrease the base colors in the image, making them appear darker. Values greater than 1.0 increase the base colors in the image, making them appear lighter.

dimension.description: The dimension to use to select the transformation, either `height`, `width`, or `both`.

dimensionVar.description: The dimension to use to select the transformation, either `height`, `width`, or `both`.

value.description: The value to compare against the source image dimension. For example, if the image dimension is less than the value the lessThan transformation is applied.

valueVar.description: The value to compare against the source image dimension. For example, if the image dimension is less than the value the lessThan transformation is applied.

colors.description: The value representing the maximum number of colors to use with the source image.

colorsVar.description: The value representing the maximum number of colors to use with the source image.

hue.description: Specify a hue by indicating the degree of rotation between 0 and 360 degrees around the color wheel. By default Mono Hue applies a red hue, 0.0 on the color wheel.

hueVar.description: Specify a hue by indicating the degree of rotation between 0 and 360 degrees around the color wheel. By default Mono Hue applies a red hue, 0.0 on the color wheel.

opacity.description: Represents alpha values on a scale of `0` to `1`. Values below `1` increase transparency, and `0` is invisible. For images that have some transparency, values above `1` increase the opacity of the transparent portions.

opacityVar.description: Represents alpha values on a scale of `0` to `1`. Values below `1` increase transparency, and `0` is invisible. For images that have some transparency, values above `1` increase the opacity of the transparent portions.

color.description: The hexadecimal CSS color value to remove.

colorVar.description: The hexadecimal CSS color value to remove.

feather.description: The RemoveColor transformation may create a hard edge around an image. To minimize these hard edges and make the removal of the color more gradual in appearance, use the Feather option. This option allows you to extend the color removal beyond the specified Tolerance. The pixels in this extended tolerance become semi-transparent - creating a softer edge.  The first realtime request for an image using the feather option may result in a slow transformation time. Subsequent requests are not impacted as they are served directly out of cache.

featherVar.description: The RemoveColor transformation may create a hard edge around an image. To minimize these hard edges and make the removal of the color more gradual in appearance, use the Feather option. This option allows you to extend the color removal beyond the specified Tolerance. The pixels in this extended tolerance become semi-transparent - creating a softer edge.  The first realtime request for an image using the feather option may result in a slow transformation time. Subsequent requests are not impacted as they are served directly out of cache.

tolerance.description: The Tolerance option defines how close the color needs to be to the selected color before it's changed to fully transparent. Set the Tolerance to 0.0 to remove only the exact color specified.

toleranceVar.description: The Tolerance option defines how close the color needs to be to the selected color before it's changed to fully transparent. Set the Tolerance to 0.0 to remove only the exact color specified.

gain.description: Set how much emphasis the filter applies to details. Higher values increase apparent sharpness of details.

gainVar.description: Set how much emphasis the filter applies to details. Higher values increase apparent sharpness of details.

sigma.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution used in the in unsharp mask, measured in pixels, `1.0` by default. High values emphasize large details and low values emphasize small details.

sigmaVar.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution used in the in unsharp mask, measured in pixels, `1.0` by default. High values emphasize large details and low values emphasize small details.

threshold.description: Set the minimum change required to include a detail in the filter. Higher values discard more changes.

thresholdVar.description: Set the minimum change required to include a detail in the filter. Higher values discard more changes.

appends.description: Places a specified `image` beside the source image. The API places the `image` on a major dimension, then aligns it on the minor dimension. Transparent pixels fill any area not covered by either image.

aspectCrops.description: Lets you change the height or width of an image (either by cropping or expanding the area) to an aspect ratio of your choosing.

backgroundColors.description: Places a transparent image on a set background color. Color is specified in the typical CSS hexadecimal format.

blurs.description: Applies a Gaussian blur to the image.

chromaKeys.description: Changes any color in an image within the specified volume of the HSL colorspace to transparent or semitransparent. This transformation applies a 'green screen' technique commonly used to isolate and remove background colors.

composites.description: Applies another image to the source image, either as an overlay or an underlay. The image that's underneath is visible in areas that are beyond the edges of the top image or that are less than 100% opaque. A common use of an overlay composite is to add a watermark.

contrasts.description: Adjusts both the contrast and brightness of an image.

faceCrops.description: Applies a method to detect faces in the source image and applies the rectangular crop on either the `biggest` face or `all` of the faces detected. Image and Video Manager tries to preserve faces in the image instead of using specified crop coordinates.

featureCrops.description: Identifies prominent features of the source image, then crops around as many of these features as possible relative to the specified `width` and `height` values.

fitAndFills.description: Resizes an image to fit within a specific size box and then uses a fill of that same image to cover any transparent space at the edges. By default the fill image has a Blur transformation with a sigma value of 8 applied, but the transformation can be customized using the fillTransformation parameter.

goops.description: Distorts an image by randomly repositioning a set of control points along a specified grid. The transformed image appears _goopy_. Adjust the density of the grid and the degree of randomity. You can use this transformation to create watermarks for use in security.

grayscales.description: Restricts image color to shades of gray only.

hsls.description: Adjusts the hue, saturation, and lightness (HSL) of an image. Hue is the number of degrees that colors rotate around the color wheel. Saturation is a multiplier to increase or decrease color saturation. Lightness is a multiplier to increase or decrease the lightness of an image. Other transformations can also affect color, such as `Grayscale` and `MaxColors`. If youre using more than one, consider the order to apply them for the desired results.

hsvs.description: Identical to HSL except it replaces `lightness` with `value`. For example, if you reduce the `lightness` of a light green, almost white, image, the color turns a vibrant green. Reducing the `value` turns the image a darker color, close to grey. This happens because the original image color is very close to white.

imQueries.description: Apply artistic transformations to images quickly and dynamically by specifying transformations with a query string appendedto the image URL.

maxColors.description: Set the maximum number of colors in the images palette. Reducing the number of colors in an image can help to reduce file size.

mirrors.description: Flips an image horizontally, vertically, or both.

monoHues.description: Allows you to set all hues in an image to a single specified hue of your choosing. Mono Hue maintains the original colors lightness and saturation but sets the hue to that of the specified value. This has the effect of making the image shades of the specified hue.

opacities.description: Adjusts the level of transparency of an image. Use this transformation to make an image more or less transparent.

regionOfInterestCrops.description: Crops to a region around a specified area of interest relative to the specified `width` and `height` values.

relativeCrops.description: Shrinks or expands an image relative to the image's specified dimensions. Image and Video Manager fills the expanded areas with transparency. Positive values shrink the side, while negative values expand it.

removeColors.description: Removes a specified color from an image and replaces it with transparent pixels. This transformation is ideal for removing solid background colors from product images photographed on clean, consistent backgrounds without any shadows.

resizes.description: Resizes an image to a particular, absolute dimension. If you don't enter a `width` or a `height`, the image is resized with the `fit` aspect preservation mode, which selects a value for the missing dimension that preserves the image's aspect.

rotates.description: Rotate the image around its center by indicating the degrees of rotation.

scales.description: Changes the image's size to different dimensions relative to its starting size.

shears.description: Slants an image into a parallelogram, as a percent of the starting dimension as represented in decimal format. You need to specify at least one axis property. Transparent pixels fill empty areas around the sheared image as needed, so it's often useful to use a `BackgroundColor` transformation for these areas.

trims.description: Automatically crops uniform backgrounds from the edges of an image.

unsharpMasks.description: Emphasizes edges and details in source images without distorting the colors. Although this effect is often referred to as _sharpening_ an image, it actually creates a blurred, inverted copy of the image known as an unsharp mask. Image and Video Manager combines the unsharp mask with the source image to create an image perceived as clearer.

gravity.description: Specifies where to place the `image` relative to the source image. The available values represent the eight cardinal directions (`North`, `South`, `East`, `West`, `NorthEast`, `NorthWest`, `SouthEast`, `SouthWest`) and a `Center` by default.

gravityPriority.description: Determines the exact placement of the `image` when `gravity` is `Center` or a diagonal. The value is either `horizontal` or `vertical`. Use `horizontal` to append an `image` east or west of the source image. This aligns the `image` on the vertical gravity component, placing `Center` gravity east. Use `vertical` to append an `image` north or south of the source image. This aligns the `image` on the horizontal gravity component, placing `Center` gravity south.

gravityPriorityVar.description: Determines the exact placement of the `image` when `gravity` is `Center` or a diagonal. The value is either `horizontal` or `vertical`. Use `horizontal` to append an `image` east or west of the source image. This aligns the `image` on the vertical gravity component, placing `Center` gravity east. Use `vertical` to append an `image` north or south of the source image. This aligns the `image` on the horizontal gravity component, placing `Center` gravity south.

gravityVar.description: Specifies where to place the `image` relative to the source image. The available values represent the eight cardinal directions (`North`, `South`, `East`, `West`, `NorthEast`, `NorthWest`, `SouthEast`, `SouthWest`) and a `Center` by default.

preserveMinorDimension.description: Whether to preserve the source image's minor dimension, `false` by default. The minor dimension is the dimension opposite the dimension that the appending `image` is placed. For example, the dimensions of the source image are 100 × 100 pixels. The dimensions of the appending `image` are 50 × 150 pixels. The `gravity` is set to `East`. This makes the major dimension horizontal and the source image's minor dimension vertical. To preserve the source image's minor dimension at 100 pixels, the `preserveMinorDimension` is set to `true`. As a result of the append, the major dimension expanded with the appended image to 150 pixels. The source image's minor dimension was maintained at 100 pixels. The total combined dimension of the image is 150 × 100 pixels.

preserveMinorDimensionVar.description: Whether to preserve the source image's minor dimension, `false` by default. The minor dimension is the dimension opposite the dimension that the appending `image` is placed. For example, the dimensions of the source image are 100 × 100 pixels. The dimensions of the appending `image` are 50 × 150 pixels. The `gravity` is set to `East`. This makes the major dimension horizontal and the source image's minor dimension vertical. To preserve the source image's minor dimension at 100 pixels, the `preserveMinorDimension` is set to `true`. As a result of the append, the major dimension expanded with the appended image to 150 pixels. The source image's minor dimension was maintained at 100 pixels. The total combined dimension of the image is 150 × 100 pixels.

boxImages.description: A rectangular box, with a specified color and applied transformation.

circleImages.description: A rectangular box, with a specified color and applied transformation.

textImages.description: A snippet of text. Defines font family and size, fill color, and outline stroke width and color.

urlImages.description: An image loaded from a URL.

color.description: The fill color of the box, not the edge of the box. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

colorVar.description: The fill color of the box, not the edge of the box. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

height.description: The height of the box in pixels.

heightVar.description: The height of the box in pixels.

width.description: The width of the box in pixels.

widthVar.description: The width of the box in pixels.

color.description: The fill color of the circle. The API supports hexadecimal representation and CSS hexadecimal color values.

diameter.description: The diameter of the circle. The diameter will be the width and the height of the image in pixels.

widthVar.description: The width of the box in pixels.

sizeVar.description: The size in pixels to render the text.

stroke.description: The color for the outline of the text.

strokeSize.description: The thickness in points for the outline of the text.

strokeSizeVar.description: The thickness in points for the outline of the text.
